str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and eimi; to be near, i.e. At hand; neuter present participle time being, or property.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To be short-sighted, blink, see dimly. From a compound of the base of musterion and ops; to shut the eyes, i.e. Blink.
Blind, physically or mentally. From, tuphoo; opaque, i.e. blind.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From katharizo; a washing off, i.e. ablution, expiation.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Of old, long ago, in times past, former. Probably another form for palin; formerly, or sometime since; ancient.
